abstract: An undirected graph has metric dimension at most k if there is a vertex set such that and , , there is a vertex such that , where is the distance (the length of a shortest path in an unweighted graph) between u and v. The metric dimension of G is the smallest integer k such that G has metric dimension at most k. A cactus block graph is an undirected graph whose biconnected components are either cycles or complete graphs. We present a linear time algorithm for computing the metric dimension of cactus block graphs.
